survey.question: How much did you enjoy the task?
How difficult was it to communicate with your partner?
How successful do you think you were at completing the task?
How difficult was it to understand your partner's instructions?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of English?
How likely is your partner to be a fluent speaker of Spanish?
How likely do you think it is that your partner is bilingual?
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: friendly
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: smart
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: collaborative
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: honest
Please rate your partner according to the following attributes: funny
How likely do you think it was that you were talking to a chatbot rather than a human?
If you were communicating with a chat bot, would you want them to communicate in both English and Spanish?

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
ready!
awesome! i'm at the starting point
hay una ramita a mi izquierda que conduce a una isla con un tigre. ¿Adónde vamos ahora, capitán?
empezamos con el mapa
yup, estoy en el mapa, justo al principio
I have a tiger to my left on a small island. Am I heading there?
yes
cool! i'm now on the tiger's island
¿Adónde vamos ahora?
cruza la ramita hacia el loro
okay, he atravesado la isla del tigre
Now I see a large parrot serving as my guide. Whats Next?
circle around the parrot to end at the rock path to the next island
done! i've circled around mr
loro y estoy mirando el camino rocoso hacia la siguiente isla. ¿Desde aquí hacia dónde, amigo?
pasa al lado de la rana hacia el arbol verde
alright, i see the frog
i'm walking toward the tree now
walk back from the green tree next to the brown tree
got it! walked back, now next to this shady brown tree
¿dirección?
cross over the crocodile towards the large black rock
ok, just crossed over past the croc - felt a little adventurous, ha! at the big black rock now
what's next?
walk over the 2 gray rocks
done! i'm at the end of the gray rocks route
¿Y ahora qué, jefe?
avoid the giraffe, get to the last branch
ok, this giraffe is dodged and i'm at the last branch now!
cross over the python and reach the chest
whoa, just crossed over the python, got my heart racing a bit there! i see the treasure chest now
*finalizado*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to go?
ready
alright, let's start! first, take a few steps west, cross that trail near the wooden bench
¡Pero no vayas demasiado lejos!
crossed the path
nice! now perform a u-turn, 180 degrees to your left and cross that trail again
head back towards where our white dog buddy is sitting
back on the other side
perfect! now, move south, passing over the branch
Sigue moviéndote hasta que veas otro perro blanco. ¿Lo ves a el?
near the white dog
cool! from there, continue west over the picnic mat, brushing up next to the berry bowl
can you see?
next to the bowl
great! move towards the northern direction and cross the river again using the branch
¿Puedes verlo?
at the bush
nice one! now circle that green bush to your right, but don’t touch it! keep going until you see a florist stand
can you see it?
at the flowers
excellent! now, make a left and head west, giving the stand a wave as you pass it under
Luego, avanza hacia el gran puente.
at the bridge
brilliant! now just keep going past the bridge, roght up until you spot two elders
see them yet?
behind the bench
fantastic! move a few steps south now, just in between that old couple’s bench and the wooden branch ahead
¡Deberías terminar junto a un arbusto verde!
done
good job! now, start moving east, continue to keep the branch and the bush beside each other

chat.msg: hi there, empezamos?
ready
so i'm at the north, there's a tent in front of me
¿Adónde debo dirigirme ahora, amigo?
head to the tan trail, stay between the rocks an the 2 bushes
alright, walking down the tan trail between those rocks and bushes
where to next?
stay on the trail until the campfire
oki, staying on track
Acabo de pasar al perro sentado cerca de la fogata. ¿a dónde me dirijo ahora?
go around the campfire avoiding the dog and the bush
sorted, i've passed the fire and avoided the dog and bush
what now, mate?
get back on the trail and head towards the blue car
Bien, ahora me dirijo al auto azul.
turn around and stay on the path around the bush next to the blue car
rooger that, moving along the path around the bush next to the blue car
what's next, my friend?
stay on the path and go between the telescope and the green bush
Estoy en ello, deslizándome entre el telescopio y el arbusto verde.
cut between the telescope and the next green bush to get back on the trail
done my friend, back on the trail again, passed the telescope and the green bush
what's next?
stay on the trail until it starts curving south
sure, staying on the trail until it starts to curve south
¡hecho!
walk on the pasture avoiding the yellow flower
cracking, i'm avoiding the yellow flower and walking across the pasture
cut across the ring of rock to the cabin
cutting through the rocks, cabin is in sight
get to the cabin
¡Muy bien, ya llegué a la cabaña, amigo! *finalizado*

chat.msg: hola, q tal? ready to start?
ready
awesome! head south-west under the first palm tree you see, then swing a right past the second tree
Gire a la izquierda antes del tercer árbol y siga hacia el sur.
estoy frente al perro
great! now, drift left of the puppy, then swerve slightly left, and then right, continuing south
keep moving
im at the tip of the rock
perfecto! now you gotta squeeze between the big rock to your left and the small one on your right
dirígete directamente al agua
estoy en la orilla
nice, now let's get a li'l wet! go straight into the water until a big red crab greets you!
between the rocks and the crab
alright
Ahora gira a la derecha, mantente cerca de esa gran roca y continúa hacia el oeste en el agua.
ok
after you pass a medium-sized rock, look out for a shark
hang a sharp right when you see it
back on the beach
¡tocar el asunto exacto! Ahora, dirígete hacia el norte a través del espacio entre la roca mediana y la bola tricolor que ves allí.
pase el balon
nice! now, veer a li'l left, head northwest
there's a red tent and a speaker - you got to cruise right between them
past the tent
awesome! now you gotta circle around that tent
después de eso, dirígete hacia el sur
at the small rock with moss
cool, now hold back from touching the water! veer right and go beneath that red kayak over there
at the kayak
cool! now make a sharp right turn and head north along that kayak

general_survey.answer: At home with my parents and sister
general_survey.question: Have you ever lived in a home environment or country where your second language was spoken? If so, please explain briefly:
On a day-to-day basis, how likely are you to have a conversation using both your first and second languages?
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At work
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? At home
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with friends
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Interacting with family
How likely would you be to mix languages in the following contexts? Using social media
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? To accommodate people who don't share the same language or language fluency.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? For social reasons; one language feels more appropriate.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I can't think of a word in the current language.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? The word in the other language just fits better.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? It's an accident, or I don't realize I'm doing it.
When you switch languages, how often is it for the following reasons? I'm more comfortable discussing the topic in the other language.
Do you enjoy mixing languages in conversation?

general_survey.answer: Sometimes it because they forgot the word, or that word just works better
